content.question: A platform of mass <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> rests on a vertical spring with spring constant <math alttext="k equals 250 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>250</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>, as shown on the left. The equilibrium length of the spring is <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. A ball of clay of mass <math alttext="0.5 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> is then placed on the platform and the system is allowed to come to rest, as shown on the right. The new equilibrium length of the spring is <math alttext="L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the difference <math alttext="L sub 1 minus L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> between the equilibrium lengths of the spring?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.02 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.02</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.06 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.06</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.08 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.08</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.10 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.02 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.02</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
